column2: Thanks to the efforts of [This.GetTitledFirstName], the [This.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty has been universally acknowledged as being directly descended from Alexander the Great.
A legendary military leader who won scores of military victories against invading Germans and Swedes. He was later canonized as a saint.
A great emperor who fought both the Seljuk Turks and the Normans. His reforms stopped the imperial decline, restoring much of the former glory.
Vanquisher of both Moors and Leonese in his campaigns for Portuguese independence, Alfonso cunningly battled many enemies to establish the roots of his own realm.
Lord over half of Iberia, Alfonso claimed the title “Emperor of all Spain” and sought to unify the peninsula under his rule. He was also known as a patron of arts.
One of the most powerful women of western Europe. She was a patron of literature and a military commander, as well as a leader in the Second Crusade.
Leader of the Almohad dynasty, the reign of Abu made both trade and science prosper, with his administrative and military skills being successful in halting the Reconquista.
Yusuf was invited by the emirs of Andalusia to come to Iberia and stop the Christian onslaught. He won, and established a vast realm extending from Ghana to Toledo.
The Kende (sacred ruler) of the Magyar tribes. He went on to conquer the Carpathian Basin, making a new home for the Hungarian people.
A powerful woman, Arwa was known for her intelligence and knowledge of both heavenly and earthly affairs. She also engaged in several building projects across Yemen.
The Ashina clan rose to prominence after revolting against the Rouran Khaganate. Members of the clan are considered sacred, if not divine, by the people of the steppe.
Famed and respected as the ruler who pushed the vikings out of the British Isles, and the first King of England.
Kubrat claims descendance from Attila - one of the most feared enemies of ancient Rome, who united numerous tribal clans under his banner.
One of the oldest Christian dynasties in the world. The children of Bagrat have made Georgia flourish throughout the centuries.
Once sold in a slave market, Baibars would eventually become the man responsible for both defeating the Mongol advance and removing the Crusader States from the Levant.
A leader of the Fourth Crusade, Baldouin fought alongside the Venetians to topple the last remnant of the Roman Empire, becoming the first Latin Emperor of Constantinople.
An able ruler, Frederick 'Barbarossa' was known both as a warrior who sought to control the rebel Italian princes and as a skilled lawmaker.
One of the greatest of the East Roman emperors, his rule brought about an era of glory, prosperity, art and imperial might.
The Daura claim descent from Bayajidda and Magajiva – the first of whom slew a great serpent, and the second of whom instituted the matriarchal system of the Hausa people.
A major leader of the First Crusade, Bohemond used his legendary martial skill and political cunning to capture Antioch and establish a kingdom for himself in the Levant.
A remarkable politician, strategist, and statesman. He successfully turned Poland into a country as powerful as the realms of the west.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] has been proclaimed by the Bards of Britain to be of the same spirit as the great Warrior Queen Boudica, who led a great revolt against the Romans.
An Irish high king of legend. He managed to unify the warring leaders of Ireland and end the Viking occupation of the isle.
An ancient British warrior. King of the Catuvellauni tribe when the Romans invaded Britain, he led a resistance that nearly prevented them from conquering the island.
A brilliant warrior as well as a great statesman, he established the Franks as undisputed masters of Gaul and led the army that defeated the Muslims in the Battle of Tours.
One of the greatest rulers India has ever seen. His conquests included the Andamans, Sri Lanka, the Maldives and even territories in Burma, Thailand and Indonesia.
The mastermind behind the Fourth Crusade and the sack of Constantinople, Enrico is remembered as one of the most successful and prosperous doges Venice ever had.
A legendary Varangian warrior. He ruled over the Kiev area, becoming its first king.
A military leader and hero of great renown. The Moors dubbed him 'El Cid' ('the Lord'), while the Christians called him 'El Campeador' ('Outstanding Warrior').
During the tumultuous years of the Abbasid caliphate, the Fatimids rose up in Ifriqiya and established their own Caliphate under [This.GetFullName].
Warrior-king of the Basques and a major sponsor of the Reconquista, Garcia restored Basque control over Navarra after a long period of Aragonese domination.
The founder of the Mongol Empire, proclaimed 'Genghis Khan' (Universal Ruler) by the many subjugated peoples of the steppe. An extremely brutal and efficient leader.
The founder of the Gahznavid dynasty. In his youth he lived as a slave, but in later life came to rule a mighty kingdom which expanded far towards India.
A legendary ruler who through skill and military might united the Kingdom of Norway and the people therein.
Known as James the Conqueror, he established dominance over the Mediterranean Sea. He is also remembered as a sponsor of artists and a notorious lawmaker.
He is famed for conquering Bahrein and establishing the Qarmatian Republic. They would go on to haunt their neighbors for many years to come.
A scholar and conqueror, Musa became a legend in the Islamic world for the vast wealth and majesty of his African kingdom. He also sponsored many construction projects.
He was the last Zoroastrian ruler who fought back against the Muslims in Persia, trying to reestablish the Sasanian Empire
By defending the integrity and dignity of the Holy See against its enemies, [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s dynasty has forever bound its fate to the Vatican.
By defending the integrity and dignity of the Holy See against its enemies, [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s dynasty has forever bound its fate to the Vatican.
The legendary founder of the Merovingian dynasty. He joined his tribal forces with Rome to drive the Huns out of Gaul, ending Attila's ambitions in the area.
Known as a champion of the faithful, diplomat and friend to Christians, Muhammad managed to keep alive the light of Al-Andalus despite the Castillian invasion.
A legendary high king of Ireland and founder of the Uí Néill dynasty. During his rule he won several battles against the Saxons, Scots, Gauls and even the Romans.
Conquered Italy, regained the old lands of the Holy Roman Empire and raised its banners once more.
Founder of the Ottoman dynasty, Osman rose to prominence as a daring commander, achieving victories against both Greeks and fellow Turks in his campaigns.
The founder of the Pala dynasty, said to be descended from the mythical Suryavansha (Sun Dynasty). He came to rule a massive kingdom, encompassing all of Bengal.
A descendant of one of the seven Parthian clans under Sassanid rule. The seven clans, or houses, played key importance in Persian history.
A pious and respected leader of the Third Crusade, Philippe fought against both heretics and infidels with great success.
Despite his involvement in the murder of his elder brother, Boleslav was a tenacious leader who significantly strengthened the Bohemian realm.
A legendary viking hero. He led numerous raids against the Franks and Anglo-Saxons, going so far as to sail up the Seine and successfully lay siege to Paris.
A great military leader and warrior who became known as 'the Lionheart'. He was a figurehead of the Third Crusade, scoring numerous victories against the Muslims.
Last of the great Norman conquerors, Roger unified Sicily under his rule, transforming it into a local power responsible for raids across the Muslim lands.
Known for combining the two separate parts of Burgundy to form the new Kingdom of Arles.
The founder of the Rurikid Dynasty. He was a Varangian chieftain who ruled over the Rus' and built several settlements, the most famous of which lies in Novgorod.
The first Sultan of Egypt and Syria. He successfully led the Muslim military campaign against the Crusader States in the Levant.
The founder of the Sassanid dynasty. Known as a great warrior, hunter and high priest of the Zoroastrian faith.
An Oghuz Turkic warlord, Seljuk started out an officer in the Khazar army. He later went on to found his own clan, seeking adventure away from his ancestral home.
The Solomonid Dynasty claim direct descendance from the biblical Solomon, a king of Israel famed for legendary wisdom and wealth.
The founder of the Tibetan Empire who unified several Tibetan kingdoms under his rule. He also introduced Buddhism to Tibet and created the Tibetan Alphabet.
In his native tongue, Timur means 'Iron'. Despite being crippled by two arrows, he was both a military genius and a statesman capable of instilling great loyalty.
By defending the integrity and dignity of the Holy See against its enemies, [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s has forever bound its fate to the Vatican.
Founder of the Tughluq dynasty, he expanded Muslim reach across the Indian subcontinent and successfully repealed the Mongol menace.
A king in sub-Roman Britain. He was a strong leader, but is notorious for hiring the Saxons as mercenaries and allowing them to enter the Isle of Britain.
Born an illegitimate bastard, he more than proved himself after successfully claiming the throne of England – becoming known as 'the Conqueror'.
A brave knight who fought in the Wars of Scottish Independence. After defeating an English army, he was appointed 'Guardian of Scotland'.
A peaceful ruler who rose to kingship through skilled diplomacy. His rule saw huge economic and cultural advancements take place in Croatia.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] has been acclaimed by many wise men as the next reincarnation of the great Ashoka, unifier of India.
[saint_person.GetSheHeCap] was known as an exemplar of the faith, and will be an inspiration for all our people for many years to come.
A great conqueror of fame and legend. With sword in hand [This.Founder.GetSheHe] would let no one stand in [This.Founder.GetHerHis] way.
The [This.Founder.GetManWoman] who restored the Kingdom of David, the land of Israel, to the Jews.
The legendary Samrat Chakravartin, uniter of all of India.
The promised Saoshyant, savior of the world and holy icon according to the Zoroastrian belief.
A [child_of_destiny.GetManWoman] of true legend. [child_of_destiny.GetHerHisCap] exploits mimicked those of Alexander the Great himself!
The bureaucratic and cultural revolution that the heavenly [This.GetTitledFirstName] has brought to [This.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have earned [This.GetHerHim] a place in the annals of history.
[This.GetSheHeCap] is known as the [This.GetKingQueen] of the first Crusader Kingdom of [This.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. A pious ruler who fought and bled for the faith.
[This.GetSheHeCap] is known for personally leading the charge of many battles, and it is said no heathen nor infidel could ever bring [This.GetHerHim] down.
Inspired by the Holy Ghost, [This.GetTitledFirstName] managed to lead a successful Crusade to free Jerusalem from the infidels when [This.GetSheHe] was merely a child.
Known for shattering the old Empire of Byzantium, and raising a new Empire from its ashes.
[This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName] was a duelist of great renown. No one would stand in [This.Founder.GetHerHis] way lest they wanted a humiliating defeat, or a swift death...
[This.GetFirstName] has become famous as a paragon of virtue and just rule throughout [This.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

Praised for spending a lifetime dedicating [This.GetHerselfHimself] to [This.GetHerHis] family, [This.GetFirstName] has immortalized [This.GetHerHis] dynasty as one of the most prestigious bloodlines in history.
[This.GetFirstName] has become infamous for [This.GetHerHis] intolerance of heretical thought and [This.GetHerHis] promotion of the most extreme form of [This.Religion.GetName] zealotry.
[This.GetFirstName] has become famous for encouraging theological studies within [This.GetHerHis] realm and being a devout patron of scholars and priests.
[This.GetFirstName] has become infamous as one of the worst tyrants in [This.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s history.
Known as a patron of the arts, [This.GetFirstName] has been celebrated by countless bards, painters and craftsmen for sponsoring their work.
[This.GetSheHeCap] single handedly brought victory to the [This.Religion.GetGroupName]s in several Crusades, and there are numerous legends spun in [This.Founder.GetHerHis] honor.
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a patron of the crafts for sponsoring the construction of several cities, churches and fortifications.
A controversial figure in [This.Culture.GetName] history, [This.GetFirstName] was a celebrated patron of the crafts, while also an alleged murderer.
[This.PrimaryTitle.GetNameCap] was unnaturally peaceful in spite of the ruler's detached attitude, leading many to weave frightening tales about the [This.GetTitle]'s silent tyranny.
[This.GetFirstName] has become infamous for [This.GetHerHis] ruthless and amoral character, prone to both violence and deceit in the pursuit of [This.GetHerHis] ambition.
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a peace-maker and a patron of the crafts for the creation of several cities.
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a peace-maker and a patron of engineering for sponsoring the construction of several castles.
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a peace-maker and a devout creator of churches.
The divine blood of [This.GetFirstName] flows through the veins of all [This.GetHerHis] descendants, carrying a glimpse of its eternal power.
[This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName] managed to unite the formerly disparate East and West Slavic people under [This.Founder.GetHerHis] rule.
[This.GetSheHeCap] is legendary among the Christians for conquering the Arabian peninsula and destroying the Muslim faiths.
After helping the Teutons in conquering the north, [Root.GetHerHis] dynasty is considered a close ally of the Teutons.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] has claimed that [Root.GetHerHis] dynasty shares blood with Phalaris, ancient Tyrant of Akragas, infamous for his use of the Brazen Bull against his enemies.
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a patron of the crafts for sponsoring the construction of several cities throughout [This.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a patron of engineering for sponsoring the construction of several castles throughout [This.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered by many as a patron of engineering and a devout [This.Religion.GetName] for sponsoring the construction of several temples in [This.GetHerHis] realm.

Since [This.GetHerHis] early childhood, [This.GetFirstName] showed an unnatural inclination for murder, which earned [This.GetHerHim] a terrible reputation amongst the brutalized members of [Root.GetHerHis] court.
The corpses of [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s enemies, embalmed by vile alchemy, still adorn [This.GetHerHis] court, an immortal testament to [This.GetHerHis] cruelty.
A cold and relentless murderer, [This.GetFirstName] has become notorious across [This.GetHerHis] realm for making people disappear without trace.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] has acquired a vicious reputation as a sadistic murder, always looking for the next victim to torment.
The members of this ruthless and infamous dynasty claim to be descendants of the Dragon-[This.GetTitle] [This.GetFirstName], notoriously famous for burning [This.GetHerHis] enemies to cinder.
Ascended to the throne when [This.GetSheHe] was merely a child, [This.GetFirstName] proved to be wise far beyond [This.GetHerHis] years, ushering a new age of prosperity for [This.GetHerHis] realm.
Hailed as the [This.GetFatherMother] of the realm, [This.GetFirstName] has been celebrated as a peacemaker and a consummate diplomat.
[This.GetFirstName] is remembered for ushering in a new age of peace and prosperity for [This.GetHerHis] realm.
Having won several wars before even reaching adulthood, [This.GetFirstName] has proven to be one of the greatest strategists of [Root.GetHerHis] age.
Hailed as the paragon of knighthood, [This.GetFirstName] has been celebrated in countless songs as a pinnacle of valor and gallantry triumphing over wickedness.
A master of the battlefield, [This.GetFirstName] has become infamous as a ruthless conqueror and implacable warrior with an unparalleled strategic genius.
The archetypal warrior-philosopher, [This.GetFirstName] has become legendary for coupling the fierceness of a fighter with the mind of a scholar.
Known for being one of the most important characters in the reconquests of the Iberian Peninsula.
Known for both fighting against and helping the infidels throughout the Reconquests of Iberia, as one of the greatest generals of our times.
The glorious restorer of the Roman Empire, who brought Europe, Africa and Asia back under Imperial rule.

Entire cities have been decimated by the raids of [This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName], etching [This.Founder.GetHerHis] legacy as one of the most fearsome and ruthless Pirates of [This.Founder.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

Entire cities have been decimated by the raids of [This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName], etching [This.Founder.GetHerHis] legacy as one of the most fearsome and ruthless Pirates of [This.Founder.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] dedicated [Root.GetHerHis] life to build an empire of blood and skulls in honor of [Root.GetHerHis] fickle and cruel gods.

Rumored to often have gone singing into battle, [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] was a [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] of a different time, [This.Founder.GetHerHis] deeds inspiring greatness in others for generations to come.

A particularly resilient [This.Founder.GetManWoman], [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] proved [This.Founder.GetHerselfHimself] one of the finest [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole]s of [This.Founder.GetHerHis] time.
[This.Founder.GetBestName] was both feared and respected, not only for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] combat prowess, but for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] relentless courage.

[This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] was known as the [This.Founder.GetEducationComplimentAdjective] leader of [This.Founder.Society.GetName] – the mention of [This.Founder.GetHerHis] courage still lights a fire in many [This.Founder.Culture.GetName] soldiers.

A highly respected [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] within [This.Founder.GetHerHis] society, this [This.Founder.GetEducationComplimentAdjective] [This.Founder.GetManWoman] was rumored to often have been charging into battle surrounded by war hounds.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] traveled far into foreign lands, fighting [This.GetHerHis] way through the best warriors of [This.GetHerHis] time. The [This.Founder.GetEducationComplimentAdjective] [This.Founder.GetManWoman] was rumored to have a supernatural affinity with birds.

Known as a great [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] and leader of others, [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] accumulated enthusiastic support during [This.Founder.GetHerHis] legendary raids into foreign lands.

[This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] was well respected within [This.Founder.Society.GetName], known for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] strategy and skill in battle, inspiring other [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole]s for years to come.

Always ready for battle, [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] became famous for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] many victories, and being the finest [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] [This.Founder.Society.GetName] had ever seen.

This [This.Founder.GetEducationComplimentAdjective] [This.Founder.GetEducationRole] made a name for [This.Founder.GetHerselfHimself] fighting for [This.Founder.Society.GetName] and spreading the way of the [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] to all who would dare challenge [This.Founder.GetHerHim].

Entire cities have been decimated by the raids of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. [Root.GetHerHisCap] actions ensured [Root.GetHerHim] the legacy of one of the most fearsome and ruthless Pirates of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

Entire cities have been decimated by the raids of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. [Root.GetHerHisCap] actions ensured [Root.GetHerHim] the legacy of one of the most fearsome and ruthless Vikings of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] has claimed that [Root.GetHerHis] dynasty shares blood with Teuta, the Pirate-Queen of the Illyrians who stood tragically against the Roman Empire of old.

The challenges that [This.Founder.GetFullName] overcame on [This.Founder.GetHerHis] rise to power were so great that the very blood that courses through [This.Founder.GetHerHis] veins is considered legendary.
A master with any weapon, [This.Founder.GetFullName] was always the first into war and the last off the battlefield.
[This.Founder.GetFullName] is said to have been one of the most beautiful [This.Founder.GetMenWomen] to ever live, not to mention a fantastic lover.
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known for [saint_person.GetHerHis] disgusting acts of cannibalism. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known for [saint_person.GetHerHis] love for alcohol. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known for [saint_person.GetHerHis] wild parties across the [saint_person.Religion.GetGroupName] realm. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known as the lover of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known for [saint_person.GetHerHis] love for the pain of others. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known for [saint_person.GetHerHis] insane and erratic actions throughout [saint_person.GetHerHis] life. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known as the lover of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
[saint_person.GetFirstName] was known for sleeping [saint_person.GetHerHis] way through the [saint_person.Religion.GetGroupName] realm. Impiously canonized by the wicked [Root.GetTitledName].
